data.title: Extending the way WinRt Game Class can be created
Fix for compiling on Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8
data.body: Define out the body of the ctor for WINRT for now.

data.title: Add Ouya controller support
data.body:
Uses all of the standard android InputDevice things, so it should work with other GamePad devices too.

GamePadCapabilities detection is currently done based on device name which is really dumb as android doesn't seem to have a way to ask if a device has a certain button.
I've added ouya and wired xbox 360 controllers to the list. (See CapabilitiesOfDevice)

My concerns with this change:
- This implementation of GamePad is in an ouya folder, but it applies to android in general (so long as it is a new enough android device. InputDevice requires sdk 9+ I think).
  Maybe we could look at replacing the existing Android GamePad implementation?
- GetCapabilities is dumb, as above. Maybe we should have a default implementation for unknown devices?

Otherwise I'm quite happy with it :-)
Please post any feedback, will make any changes/tidyups required.

data.title: More VS Templates Fixes
data.body:
Even more template fixes:
- Fixed incorrect hardcoded GUIDs in the templates.
- Fixed bad substitution vars in AssemblyInfo files.
- Fixed the unnecessary differences in the AssemblyInfo files.
- Renamed template folder Windows to WindowsGL.
- Renamed template folder Game to WindowsStore.
- Renamed template folder XamlGame to WindowsStoreXaml.

data.title: [Windows8] Fixing Compile Error on Debug (AllowUnsafeBlocks to true)
data.body:
Need to AllowUnsafeBlocks on Debug Mode
The function float Convert(ushort value) - HalfTypeHelper
uses it

data.title: Added OUYA project file.
data.body:
Added OUYA project template.
Modified installer script to install OUYA files.

No specific OUYA functionality (GamePad support for OuyaController) yet. That's next.

data.title: Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceInformation.DeviceType is invalid in XNA 4.0
data.body: XNA 4.0 uses Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceInformation.GraphicsProfile instead, which is unavailable in MonoGame.

data.title: Added the get acessor to Indices Property of GraphicDevices
data.body: To be Possible to recover the binded Index Buffer (same as xna 4)

data.title: Issue 1149 revision 3
data.body:
This one includes template icons and graphics that needed to be updated desperately. Corrected the fuzzy monogame logo and added iOS and Windows specific spash graphics. See the readme for details.

This supercedes revision 2 - 1149_R2

data.title: Graphics and logos for new marketing graphics issue.
data.body: some new graphics and icons that only have the logo without the logo text. added a bevel effect to the logo and created both windows and mac high resolution icons.

data.title: Better Marketing Graphics (aka Better Template Icons PR 1148)
data.body: We need some improvements to the marketing graphics for MonoGame. There also needs to be a published set of guidelines for referencing MonoGame in graphics or text which would require print-quality logo graphics.

data.title: Better Template Icons
data.body:
I did a quick a pass making new icons for the VS templates.

I'm not totally in love with this...  but they are consistent and somewhat more accurate compared to what we had before.

data.title: Fix MonoGame.Framework.dll.config to be named properly on MacOS and Linux
data.body:
The output DLLs for MacOS and Linux were [recently renamed](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/commit/9a77339a68916dbc83b774bb0df495e58ac6fa41) to not include any suffix.

This commit updates the output names of the correspondig .dll.config files to match the new names. 

This is required for MonoGame to work at all on Mac and Linux.

data.title: Implementing OpenAL for Android
data.body:
Hey, 

I was told that OpenAL is not available for use with android and MonoGame.

Was wondering why that was?

I found a OpenAL impplementation for it.
https://github.com/AerialX/openal-soft-android

and i found a forum describing its use in Mono for Android.
http://mono-for-android.1047100.n5.nabble.com/Getting-OpenAl-working-td5712296.html

Is this feasible?

data.title: Spritefonts are rendering text as blocks
data.body:
I am using the latest current beta code as of today (1/3/2012) and loading a .xnb file built from VS 2010.

For some reason the text is not readable, and shows up in blocks: http://imgur.com/jnAEm

data.title: Fix OpenGL StencilOp mapping
data.body: Fix OpenGL StencilOp mapping. GL_INCR / GL_DECR are clamped which correspond to StencilOperation.{Increment|Decrement}Saturation in XNA.

data.title: Update README.md
data.body:
Someone needs to take the time to update the README.md file.

For sure we need to remove news...  it will always be out of date.

Redirect some of the stuff to the new website for things like featured games and roadmap.

In general it can probably be much simpler now.  Maybe go look over the .MD files for other big projects on Github for ideas.

data.title: VS Template Fixes
data.body:
A few fixes after reviewing the latest installers:
- Unified the convention for names and descriptions of all the Visual Studio templates.
- All game templates default to "GameName" as the default project name.
- Fixed incorrect executable type in Windows template (was building console exes).

data.title: iOS sound effect plays at higher octave than on Win7/Android
data.body:
I have WAV files for Santa Shooter that work fine on Win Phone 7, Win Phone 8, and Android. When played on an iPod Touch G3 or iPhone 4, the playback results in a higher octave for the sounds. For instance, a swoosh sound on Android sounds like a bubble pop on iOS.

The WAV files are processed using the iOS content builder and sent to the device as XNB files. The files were built as MG Sound Effect.

Ray Batts, if this is your prevue, then I am happy to send you the XNB and WAV files as zip files. The content is not very large, maybe 512KB of data.

data.title: Fix for Android Cancel/Outside touch event / Added SensorBase.CurrentValue update
data.body: I don't know why, the two commits came in the same pull request, and I can't figure out how to create a pull request with only one commit.

data.title: Added HalfVector4 and Short4
data.body:
Fixes issue #1133.
Added the HalfVector4 and Short4 types.  Still missing several PackedVector types.
All projects now consistently include all currently implemented PackedVector types.

data.title: MGFX Improvements
Fix crash launching landscape Windows 8 app in portrait
data.body:
Fixes issue #1136
Calculate the back buffer scale in terms of the same orientation as the preferred back buffer size.  Avoids crazy scales such as (1.7, 0.5) causing back buffers of 2430x432 and "Not enough storage" exceptions.

data.title: Viewport Not correct on Windows Surface RT Device
data.body:
Guys

Can those of you with a SurfaceRT device take a look and see if you can replicate this bug report I got from one of my contacts at Microsoft?

"I've been playing around using my SurfaceRT as a target platform. The native resolution of the device is 1366, 768.  When I start a demo app with the Surface oriented horizontally everything seems to be fine.  When I start up with the Surface in portrait mode the device state is strange:
          ScissorRectangle      {X:0 Y:0 Width:1366 Height:768}
          Viewport              {[Viewport: X=0 Y=0 Width=2430 Height=432]}
 The Viewport values are way off.  Interestingly, this doesn't occur in the simulator.
 Any idea what might be going on?"

Deam

data.title: Removed unnecessary window resize blocking
data.body:
I messed around with this for a little while, and ended up with a huge patch fixing quite a few window management things. 

As the proper patch needs cleaning up a lot, I'm submitting this as a super-quick fix for issue #1069.

_Tested on Linux/Windows/Mac only._

data.title: Implement GetData() for IndexBuffer & VertexBuffer on WinRT
Where has the Graphics.PackedVector.Short4 gone?
data.body: I searched in the file repository too, but only found the short2.cs, the short4.cs is not available.

data.title: Windows template is missing for Visual Studio 2012
data.body: The "MonoGame Application For Windows" template should be added to the Visual Studio 2012 project template folder, and not only to the Visual Studio 2010 project template folder. Just because you're using Visual Studio 2012 it doesn't mean that you want to target Windows Store.

data.title: [ANDROID][MonoGame 3.0 (BETA)] RenderTarget2D.ContentLost not called
data.body:
RenderTarget2D lost it's content if you press home button in my phone (ZTE Blade CDMA on CyanogenMod 7.2), but ContentLost event not called.

In Windows XNA, RenderTarget2D lost it's content if I minimize the window but if I restore it, ContentLost event called so I can redraw it's content.

data.title: Removed excessive debug logs from model load
data.body: There were quite a few Debug.WriteLine() calls in the model loader that did not need to be there and produced excessive logs, especially on Android where the logs are duplicated in adb output.  Also removed a 'colourful' debug log from LzxDecoder.
